clinical_study.brief_title: The Implementation of Educational Interventions on the Prescribing of Antimicrobial Drugs in Primary Health Care
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of the Implementation of Educational Interventions Based on Scientific Evidence on the Prescribing of Antimicrobial Drugs in Primary Health Care

collaborator.agency: Interdisciplinary section for the control of antibiotic resistance (ISKRA)

brief_summary.textblock: World increase in mortality from consequences of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) represents a significant public health problem. Irrational prescribing of antimicrobial drugs (AMD) in general population is one of the main causes of development AMR. This is also contributed by fact that up to 90% of total antimicrobial consumption in Europe is related to the general population. Problem of AMR has been recognized by World Health Organization and Council of European Union, which support the establishment of the antimicrobial stewardship team (A-team). A-team provides co-ordinated interventions that promote rational use of AMD. To date, no study has been carried out in which Ateam from hospital environment goes to primary health care for the purpose of rationalization prescribing of AMD by primary health care practitioners. Project for implementation of hospital A-team in primary health care in Koprivnica-Križevci County will be initiated using educational outreach method aimed at rationalization of the consumption of AMD.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of antimicrobials expressed as DDD per 1000 inhabitants per day for ATC group J01
primary_outcome.description: Rationalization of general consumption of antimicrobials

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of antimicrobials expressed as DDD per 1000 inhabitants per day for ATC group J01 associated with acute respiratory tract infections
primary_outcome.description: Rationalization of consumption of antimicrobials for acute respiratory tract infections (for associated ICD diagnoses J01, J02, J03, J06, J20)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clostridiodes dificile infection for patients on antimicrobial therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Clostridiodes dificile infection for patients on antimicrobial therapy. A case of Clostridioides difficile infection (CDI) is defined as diarrhoeal stools or toxic megacolon and a positive laboratory assay for C. difficile toxin A and/or B in stools or a toxin-producing C. difficile organism detected in stool via culture or other means e.g. a positive PCR result.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of antimicrobials expressed as DDD per 1000 inhabitants per day for ATC group J01 associated with urinary tract infections
secondary_outcome.description: Rationalization of consumption of antimicrobials for urinary tract infections

arm_group.arm_group_label: Hospital A-team led intervention in Koprivnica Križevci County
arm_group.description: Hospital A-team will give educational outreach intervention to primary care physicians
Primary care physicians in Bjelovar Bilogora county will not receive intervention

intervention.description: Educational outreach or academic detailing is a method based on scientific data with the help of educated A-team members in the form of direct (face-to-face) interactions, prescribing practices change and adherence improves according to the application of currently valid therapeutic guidelines
intervention.arm_group_label: Hospital A-team led intervention in Koprivnica Križevci County

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All primary care physicians in Koprivnica Križevci County that agree to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Primary care physicians outside Koprivnica Križevci County
